results.title: Ah...we humans
results.brief_description: A non-narrated, animated cartoon with humorous sound effects, giving an understanding of how people react when confronted with behaviour patterns different from their own. Deals with a number of concepts related to groups and conflict: cultural awareness, beliefs and ignorance, scarce resources and the value of alliances. No other credits available.

results.title: Agriculture today in Japan
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Productions for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the modern methods widely used in Japanese agriculture due to the influence of the country’s increasing industrialisation. Illustrates scientific farming methods, co-operative production and marketing.

results.title: Agriculture in Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the highly organized and productive farming methods of Japan, a small, densely populated country where every available square foot of land is valued. Profiles rice planting and its cultivation, stressing the high quotient of manual labour used in Japanese agricultural methods. The different kinds of produce are clearly defined and their cultivation topically treated.

results.title: Agora
results.brief_description: ‘Agora’ centres on the fear and panic of being lost in a crowded fairground, as a young girl befriends another lost boy hiding under a bus. The pair cleverly devise a strategy to make themselves seen as well as heard!

results.title: Aging
results.creator_credit: CRM Educational Films, McGraw-Hill Films and Peter Jordon
results.brief_description: Examines some popular, although often mistaken, attitudes towards the aged and their places in life. Discusses two major theories: the activity theory and leisure world with Dr Vern Bengston of USC and the disengagement theory.

results.title: Agility and tumbling
results.brief_description: The gymnastics performance of a class of ten to twelve year old girls. The girls do simple basic agility such as forward rolls, backward rolls, headstands, headstands and cartwheels, then gradually progress to combinations of these as well as handsprings, one handed cartwheels and round-offs.

results.title: Aggressive behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera, Phil Content and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
Aggression is a concentrated, focussed reaction to lack of security and approval. Within the classroom aggression on the part of teachers can take the form of verbal abuse, stridency and belittling techniques to satisfy the teacher’s need for security at the expense of pupils. The film shows that pupils can respond to this behaviour by aggression in return or by withdrawal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera, Phil Content and FilmFair Communications

results.title: Aggression - assertion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Moral Decision Making”.
By showing causes and expressions of aggression and self-assertion in a family and neighbourhood situation, this film aims to motivate classroom discussion. When assailed by the hostility of his brother and unable to retaliate, Joe goes off with his friends. In the course of their walk Joe see a radio on top of a garbage tin and becomes embroiled with Ed who also wants possession of the radio. Various responses which people might make in this situation are depicted.

results.title: Ageing Parents
results.brief_description: Many children regard their parents as a burden. This thought-provoking program explores what it feels like to get older. Elderly parents, their children and teenagers talk about how they relate to each other, their expectations and ways of keeping the lines of communication open - before it’s too late.
